column3: Description
When meeting people it remembers who they are, the context, what was discussed and contact info.
Capture emotions through social media platform. Auto-generate custom AR filters based on emotional state.
Detects when user is relacxed & not busy to prompt w/ intersting & relevant articles to read.
When seen through AR it displays custom elements set by the user. E.g. fantasy sports trophies.
An interactive arm display that shows current energy level and what to do about it.
Arm wearbale to make gaming streams more interactive. Read out streamer messages and use gestures as hotkeys for emotes.
Virtual whiteboard in AR where you can gesture to swap between visuals and use haptic feedback to draw.
The ultimate audio & sensory expereience with favorite show. Audio profile personalized & vibrations depending on scene.
Stretchable wearable on hand for discrete text-entry on-the-go for AR.
Music fesitval arm sleeve tattoo that changes color wiith music and helps keep track of friends while monitoring your health.

column2: Automatic Home Temperature System Using Body Temp Sensors
column3: A body temperature sensor attached to the user will communicate with the thermostat to maintain temperature that is just right for the user
Head mounted AR headsets are big, expensive and mostly wired. A Stretchable display can stick to a user's glass lens to convert them into AR glasses
A stretchable battery which will stick to your wrist and can charge a wearable such as an Apple Watch or a Fitbit. it's like an additional battery pack.

A smart patch that users can attach anywhere on their body, which will monitor for comfort such as tracking for dehydration. Data will go to a screen that flight attendants can track and provide service accordingly. For long haul flights.

column2: AR Weight Lifting Coach for Proper Form
column3: AR headset/glasses which will project the proper form for weight lifting and will allow the user to follow along and replicate the form (the coach will be a stick figure superimposed on the user)

column2: Hand Gesture Recognition & Control for Phone, Laptop & AR
column3: Small sensors (EMG) which can stretch and cover finger tips to allow the user to control their AR device, laptop and phone by waving their hand or using other gestures.

column2: Holographic Projection Using AR for Long Distance Communication
column3: AR glasses which can project a person to make it seem like they're right in front of the user feel like they're physically talking to the person
A display which can stretch over clothing (shirts, pants, jackets, socks)

column2: Remote Health Monitoring & AR Doctor's Appointments
column3: Using 2-way AR glasses and heart rate sensors to allow doctors to remotely monitor a patient and to save time on in-person appointments through AR appointments which the patient can do at home

column2: Prosthetic Limb Control Using EMG Sensors
column3: Stretchable EMG sensor to wirelessly control prosthetic limbs
Real estate and AR combined to give real estate agents the ability to show clients a fully furnished building. Could fit with heart rate sensor to tell how much a person likes the property.

column2: Road to Recovery: tracking of joint movement with AR
column3: Using flexible sensors paired with AR recovering surgery patients can tell the exact range of motion of their joint which then can be relayed to the doctor.

column2: Car map: AR directions on windshield
column3: Use AR principles to display maps/directions onto windshield of cars. people won't have to look down for directions anymore.

column2: FirefighAR: AR helmet for vitals on firefighters
column3: AR helpemt with sensing to display hot spots, personal vitals, and O2 levels. Info also networked to captain outside.

column2: Heart Smart: Elderly tracking for falls and emergencies
column3: Flexible patch for elderly living alone to know if they felll and then take heart rate, blood pressure readings to know if they are having an emergency. It so, the police are informed.

column2: Pharm Count: AR headset counters for pharmacies
column3: AR used in pharmacies to prevent countring and incorrect identification errors. Using computer vision headset displays the pill being counted and current count.

column2: Quick BAC: BAC patch to know if you can drive
column3: Flexible/wearable sensor to display BAC via smartphone to user. If over limit provides easy way to hail taxi instead of driving.
AR glasses paired with phone to received. Also can take video calls on the go so you don't have to look down or hold your phone up.

column2: Sugar Sense: sensor based blood sugar monitor
column3: Wearable/flexible electronic patch that senses blood sugar and blood pressure levels for diabetic patients without finger pricks.

column2: Skin ID: AR and stretchable sensors into a display
column3: Use a combo of AR and flexible sensors to use your arm as a display for the sensor readings (heart rate, blood pressure, etc.)
